snippet: When the mayor of Fort Lee, N.J., declined to endorse Gov. Chris Christie for re-election, most of the town’s access lanes to the bridge were suddenly shut.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column observes that when the Democratic mayor of Fort Lee, NJ, declined to endorse Gov Chris Christie for re-election, two of three of town’s access lanes to George Washington Bridge bridge were suddenly shut for five days in September; says motive for shutdown that turned Fort Lee into a parking lot for days remains matter of speculation, but possibilities are most likely stupidity, retribution and political hack work.
lead_paragraph: When the mayor of Fort Lee, N.J., declined to endorse Gov. Chris Christie for re-election, most of the town’s access lanes to the bridge were suddenly shut.

headline.main: Investigating Political Hack Work Near the George Washington Bridge
headline.print_headline: Investigating Political Hack Work Near the George Washington Bridge

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
